title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.
speech: Identify what you are solving for.
pacedSpeech: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the time it takes the two drivers to become $$330$$ miles apart.
speech: You are solving for the time it takes the two drivers to become  330  miles apart.
pacedSpeech: You are solving for the time it takes the two drivers to become   330

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the time that it takes the drivers to become $$330$$ miles apart. Let the variable be $$x$$.
speech: Create a variable to represent the time that it takes the drivers to become  330  miles apart. Let the variable be  x, .
pacedSpeech: Create a variable to represent the time that it takes the drivers to become   330
miles apart. Let the variable be   x,

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the time two drivers drived are the same, but the directions are different, and the distance equals $$speed time$$.
speech: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the time two drivers drived are the same, but the directions are different, and the distance equals  speedtime .
pacedSpeech: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the time two drivers drived are the same, but the directions are different, and the distance equals   speedtime

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get that $$72x+76x=330$$ (since they are moving away from each other).
speech: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get that  72 x plus 76 x is equal to 330  (since they are moving away from each other).
pacedSpeech: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get that   72 x plus 76 x is equal to 330
(since they are moving away from each other).

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for $$x$$? (don't forget the rounding)

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$72x+76x=330$$, we follow these steps: 72x+76x=330-->148x=330-->x=2.23.

speech: After solving the equation, what do you get for  x ? (don't forget the rounding)
pacedSpeech: After solving the equation, what do you get for   x
